turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Agora (web browser).
turn.2: Agora (web browser) Agora was a World Wide Web email browser and was a proof of concept to help people to use the full internet.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Agora was an email-based web browser designed for non-graphic terminals and to help people without full access to the internet such as in developing countries or without a permanent internet connection.
turn.6: Similar to W3Gate, Agora was a server application designed to fetch HTML documents through e-mail rather than http.
turn.7: What was the most important aspect of this article?
turn.8: Agora was not a client application.
turn.10: To access the Internet you had to install the Agora browser on a server and send Agora an email with the requested URL.
turn.12: The Agora application would send an email back with the requested content of the link.
